Home → New suggestions → Reviews

Reviews

Read staff and customer reviews of books and reserve to collect from your library, or download to your device.

The Shepherd’s Life: A Tale of the Lake District by James Rebanks

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Apr 21, 2020

The Shepherd’s Life: A Tale of the Lake District offers an alternative insight into the attractions and life of the Lake District and an honest view of continuing a six hundred year old family tradition of farming.

The Sky is Mine by Amy Beashel

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Apr 16, 2020

Beashel is a shining new voice in YA, with brilliant dialogue and character craft.

Fallen Land by Patrick Flanery

Written by · Published Mar 31, 2020

Fallen Land is a tragic, unforgettable tale.

Harley in the Sky by Akemi Dawn Bowman

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 12, 2020

Harley in the Sky was a memorable and completely entrancing read that just cemented Bowman’s status as a phenomenal writer.

This is going to hurt: Secret diaries of a junior doctor by Adam Kay

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Mar 5, 2020

Secret diaries of a junior doctor is an entertaining read with it’s laugh-out-loud parts and very readable style of writing.

The Handmaid's Tale by Margaret Atwood

Written by Kesgrave Library Book Group 1 · Published Feb 18, 2020

The Handmaid's Tale is a compelling, well-written book that sparked lots of discussion.

Anatomy of a Scandal by Sarah Vaughan

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Feb 11, 2020

Anatomy of a Scandal is a topical, thought-provoking page-turner with well-rounded, sympathetic characters.

Bitter Orange by Claire Fuller

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Dec 31, 2019

Bitter Orange is an off-kilter quick and easy read that prompted lots of discussion.

Days Without End by Sebastian Barry

Written by Sue Orton · Published Dec 19, 2019

Days Without End is a truly memorable story of a life spent trying to survive.

The Sea House by Esther Freud

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Dec 3, 2019

The Sea House is well-written and enjoyable, with a familiar setting.
